User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...

2. PlayerRecommendation
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

### Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem
   - Attributes:
     - employees (List<Employee>)

2. Employee
   - Attributes:
     - role
     - name

3. HeadCoach
   - Attributes:
     - designatedPlayerProfiles (List<PlayerProfile>)

4. Director
   - Attributes:
     - scoutingAssignments (List<ScoutingAssignment>)

5. Scout
   - Attributes:
     - longList (List<Player>)
     - scoutingReports (List<ScoutingReport>)

6. Player
   - Attributes:
     - name
     - position (PlayerPosition)
     - attributes (List<PlayerAttribute>)

7. PlayerProfile
   - Attributes:
     - targetPositions (List<PlayerPosition>)
     - otherAttributes (List<PlayerAttribute>)

8. ScoutingAssignment
   - Attributes:
     - player (Player)
     - scout (Scout)
     - completionStatus

9. ScoutingReport
   - Attributes:
     - player (Player)
     - pros
     - cons
     - recommendation (PlayerRecommendation)

10. ShortList
    - Attributes:
      - players (List<Player>)

11. OfficialOffer
    - Attributes:
      - player (Player)

12. PlayerAttribute
    - Attributes:
      - name
      - value

User:List all the classes and enumerations using format:
Enumerations:
1.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
2.enumeration(literals):[one-sentence rationale]
...
Classes:
1.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
2.classname(attributeName1: attributeType1, attributeName2: attributeType2 ):[one-sentence rationale]
...

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, ...): Represents the various designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, ...): Represents the recommendations for a player after scouting.

### Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(employees: List<Employee>): Represents the system used by club employees for scouting players.
2. Employee(role: string, name: string): Represents an employee of the club with a specific role and name.
3. HeadCoach(designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>): Represents the head coach who identifies player profiles for signings.
4. Director(scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents the director of the club responsible for scouting assignments.
5. Scout(longList: List<Player>, scoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>): Represents a scout who maintains a long list of players and scouting reports.
6. Player(name: string, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player with a name, position, and attributes.
7. PlayerProfile(targetPositions: List<PlayerPosition>, otherAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute]): Represents a player profile with target positions and other attributes.
8. ScoutingAssignment(player: Player, scout: Scout, completionStatus: string): Represents a scouting assignment for a player assigned to a scout.
9. ScoutingReport(player: Player, pros: string, cons: string, recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report for a player with pros, cons, and recommendations.
10. ShortList(players: List<Player>): Represents a short list of players selected for further consideration.
11. OfficialOffer(player: Player): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.
12. PlayerAttribute(name: string, value: string): Represents an attribute of a player with a name and value.

#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. AI:### Enumerations:
1. **PlayerPosition**
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...
   
2. **PlayerRecommendation**
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

### Classes:
1. **Employee**
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Role

2. **HeadCoach**
   - Attributes:
     - DesignatedPlayerProfiles (List of PlayerPosition)
     
3. **Scout**
   - Attributes:
     - LongList (List of Players)
     - ScoutingAssignments (List of Players)
     
4. **Player**
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Attributes (List of Name-Value pairs)
     - ScoutingReports (List of ScoutingReport)
     
5. **ScoutingReport**
   - Attributes:
     - Pros
     - Cons
     - Recommendation (PlayerRecommendation)
     
6. **HeadScout**
   - Attributes:
     - ShortList (List of Players)
     - ScoutingAssignments (List of Players)
   
7. **Director**
   - Attributes:
     - OfficialOffer (Player)
   
### Attributes:
- **Player**
  - Name
  - Attributes (List of Name-Value pairs)
  - ScoutingReports (List of ScoutingReport)
  
- **ScoutingReport**
  - Pros
  - Cons
  - Recommendation (PlayerRecommendation)

AI:### Enumerations:
1. **PlayerPosition (GK, LB, ...)**
   - Represents the designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.

2. **PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, ...)**
   - Represents the recommendations that can be made for a player after scouting.

### Classes:
1. **Employee (Name: String, Role: String)**
   - Represents an employee of the club with a name and role in the system.

2. **HeadCoach (DesignatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>)**
   - Represents the head coach with designated player profiles for future signings.

3. **Scout (LongList: List<Player>, ScoutingAssignments: List<Player>)**
   - Represents a scout with a long list of players and scouting assignments.

4. **Player (Name: String, Attributes: List<Name-Value>, ScoutingReports: List<ScoutingReport>)**
   - Represents a player with a name, attributes, and scouting reports.

5. **ScoutingReport (Pros: String, Cons: String, Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation)**
   - Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation for a player.

6. **HeadScout (ShortList: List<Player>, ScoutingAssignments: List<Player>)**
   - Represents the head scout with a short list of players and scouting assignments.

7. **Director (OfficialOffer: Player)**
   - Represents the director who can make an official offer for a player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition(GK, LB, ...): Represents the designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.
2. PlayerAttribute: Represents the various attributes of a player identified during scouting.

### Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem(headCoach: Employee, director: Employee, scouts: List<Employee>, shortListedPlayers: List<Player>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents the overall system used by the club for scouting players.
   
2. Employee(name: String, role: String): Represents an employee of the club involved in the scouting process.

3. Player(name: String, position: PlayerPosition, attributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player being scouted, including their attributes.

4. ScoutingAssignment(scout: Employee, player: Player, scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents an assignment given to a scout to evaluate a player.

5. ScoutingReport(pros: List<String>, cons: List<String>, recommendation: String): Represents the report submitted by a scout about a player, including pros, cons, and a recommendation.

6. Offer(player: Player, director: Employee): Represents an official offer made by the club's director for a player.

8. ShortList(players: list): Represents a short list of players for further evaluation.
9. OfficialOffer(player: Player): Represents an official offer made by the director for a player.

Classes:
1. Employee(Name: string, Role: string):Represents an employee of the club with a name and role within the organization.
2. HeadCoach(DesignatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>):Manages identifying designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Scout(LongList: List<Player>):Maintains a list of players matching designated target profiles for scouting.
4. Player(Name: string, Attributes: List<Attribute>):Represents a player with a name and associated attributes.
5. ScoutingAssignment(Scout: Scout, Player: Player, ScoutingReport: ScoutingReport):Associates a scout with a player for scouting and includes the scouting report.
6. ScoutingReport(Pros: string, Cons: string, Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation):Contains the pros, cons, and recommendation for a player after scouting.
7. HeadScout(ShortList: List<Player>):Manages short-listed players for further evaluation.
8. Director(OfficialOffer: Offer):Makes official offers for players recommended for signing.

AI:Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, CB, RB, CDM, CM, CAM, LW, RW, CF): Represents the various positions a player can play in a team.
2. PlayerRecommendation (Key Player, First Team Player, Reserve Team Player, Prospective Player, Not a Good Signing): Represents the recommendations for a player based on scouting reports.

Classes:
1. Employee(Name: String, Role: String): Represents an employee of the club with a name and role.
2. HeadCoach(DesignatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>): Represents the head coach with designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Scout(LongList: List<Player>, ScoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents a scout with a long list of players and scouting assignments.
4. ScoutingAssignment(Player: Player, ScoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment for a player with a scouting report.
5. ScoutingReport(Pros: String, Cons: String, Recommendation: PlayerRecommendation): Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation.
6. HeadScout(ShortList: List<Player>): Represents the head scout with a short list of players.
7. Director(OfficialOffer: Offer): Represents the director with an official offer for a player.
8. Player(Name: String, Position: PlayerPosition): Represents a player with a name and position, and methods for comparing scouting results and moving to a shortlist.

### Classes:

User:Generate the lists of enumerations, classes and attributes from a given <Description>.
#Description 
The Team Sports Scouting System is used by various employees of the club, including the head coach, the director of the club and the scouts. It is the role of the head coach to identify designated player profiles for future signings, which includes designated target positions for a player (e.g. GK for goalkeeper, LB for left back, etc.), and other player attributes (identified by a name and a value).

Scouts may note players a long list who seem to match a designated target profile at any time. This long list is periodically evaluated by the head scout when setting up scouting assignments for his team to investigate a specific player more thoroughly. As the completion of a scouting assignment, the scout submits a scouting report about the player, which includes the pros and cons of the player as well as a recommendation (e.g. key player, first team player, reserve team player, prospective player, not a good signing). 

After comparing first scouting results for a designated player profile, the head coach and the head scout decide upon which players to move to the short list. Several other rounds of scouting can be carried out for each short-listed player as part of scouting assignments-some of which is carried out by the head scout himself. If a player is finally recommended for signing by the head scout, the director makes an official offer for the player.

AI:### Enumerations:
1. **PlayerPosition**
   - GK (Goalkeeper)
   - LB (Left Back)
   - ...

2. **PlayerRecommendation**
   - Key Player
   - First Team Player
   - Reserve Team Player
   - Prospective Player
   - Not a Good Signing

### Classes:
1. **Employee**
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Role

2. **Player**
   - Attributes:
     - Name
     - Position (PlayerPosition)
     - OtherAttributes (List of Name-Value pairs)

3. **ScoutingAssignment**
   - Attributes:
     - AssignedPlayer (Player)
     - AssignedBy (Employee)
     - EvaluationDate

4. **ScoutingReport**
   - Attributes:
     - Player (Player)
     - Pros
     - Cons
     - Recommendation (PlayerRecommendation)

5. **ShortListedPlayer**
   - Attributes:
     - Player (Player)
     - ScoutingRounds (List of ScoutingAssignment)

6. **OfficialOffer**
   - Attributes:
     - Player (Player)
     - OfferedBy (Employee)

### Attributes:
- **HeadCoach**
  - DesignatedPlayerProfiles (List of PlayerPosition)

- **HeadScout**
  - LongList (List of Player)
  - ShortList (List of ShortListedPlayer)

- **Director**
  - OfficialOffers (List of OfficialOffer)

AI:### Enumerations:
1. PlayerPosition (GK, LB, ...): Represents the different designated target positions for a player in the scouting system.
2. PlayerAttribute (name, value): Represents the attributes of a player identified by a name and a value.
3. Recommendation (KeyPlayer, FirstTeamPlayer, ...): Represents the recommendations for a player after scouting.

### Classes:
1. TeamSportsScoutingSystem (headCoach: HeadCoach, director: Director, scouts: List<Scout>): Represents the main system used by the club for scouting players.
2. HeadCoach (designatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerProfile>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Scout (longList: List<Player>, scoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>): Represents the scout who notes players and carries out scouting assignments.
4. ScoutingAssignment (scoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a specific assignment to scout a player and submit a report.
5. ScoutingReport (pros: List<String>, cons: List<String>, recommendation: Recommendation): Represents the report submitted by a scout after scouting a player.
6. HeadScout (shortList: List<Player>, scoutingRounds: List<ScoutingRound>): Represents the head scout who manages short-listed players and scouting rounds.
7. Director (officialOffer: Offer): Represents the director who makes an official offer for a player.
8. Player (playerPosition: PlayerPosition, playerAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player with their position and attributes.

Classes:
1. Employee(Role: String): Represents an employee of the club with a specific role.
2. HeadCoach(DesignatedPlayerProfiles: List<PlayerPosition>): Represents the head coach who identifies designated player profiles for future signings.
3. Director: Represents the director of the club.
4. Scout(LongList: List<Player>, ScoutingAssignments: List<ScoutingAssignment>, ScoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scout who notes players, sets scouting assignments, and submits scouting reports.
5. Player(PlayerPosition: PlayerPosition, PlayerAttributes: List<PlayerAttribute>): Represents a player with a position and attributes.
6. ScoutingAssignment(ScoutingReport: ScoutingReport): Represents a scouting assignment with a scouting report.
7. ScoutingReport(Pros: String, Cons: String, Recommendation: Recommendation): Represents a scouting report with pros, cons, and a recommendation.
8. ShortList: Represents a short list of players.
9. OfficialOffer: Represents an official offer for a player.
